from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# List of new column names
columns = [
    "kunta", 
    "vuosi", 
    "toimintakulut_tilastovuonna", 
    "henkilostokulut", 
    "kirjastoaineistokulut", 
    "kirjojen_hankintakulut", 
    "e_aineistokulut", 
    "tilakustannukset", 
    "muut_kulut", 
    "toimintakulut_kuluvan_vuoden_talousarviossa", 
]

# Loop through each column and count the number of null values
null_counts = {}
for column in columns:
    null_count = df_economy.filter(F.col(column).isNull()).count()
    null_counts[column] = null_count

# Display the results
for column, count in null_counts.items():
    print(f"Number of null values in '{column}': {count}")

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# List of new column names
columns = [
    "kunta", 
    "vuosi", 
    "suomenkielinen_vaesto", 
    "ruotsinkielinen_vaesto", 
]

# Loop through each column and count the number of null values
null_counts = {}
for column in columns:
    null_count = df_lang.filter(F.col(column).isNull()).count()
    null_counts[column] = null_count

# Display the results
for column, count in null_counts.items():
    print(f"Number of null values in '{column}': {count}")

df_combined = df_economy.join(df_lang, on=["kunta", "vuosi"], how="left")
df_all_combined=df_combined.join(df_population, on=["kunta", "vuosi"], how="left")
display(df_all_combined)
for column in df_all_combined.columns:
    print(column)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# List of new column names
columns = [
    "kunta", 
    "vuosi", 
    "toimintakulut_tilastovuonna", 
    "henkilostokulut", 
    "kirjastoaineistokulut", 
    "kirjojen_hankintakulut", 
    "e_aineistokulut", 
    "tilakustannukset", 
    "muut_kulut", 
    "toimintakulut_kuluvan_vuoden_talousarviossa", 
    "suomenkielinen_vaesto", 
    "ruotsinkielinen_vaesto"
]

# Loop through each column and count the number of null values
null_counts = {}
for column in columns:
    null_count = df_all_combined.filter(F.col(column).isNull()).count()
    null_counts[column] = null_count

# Display the results
for column, count in null_counts.items():
    print(f"Number of null values in '{column}': {count}")

# Define output path
output_path = "abfss://vaesto@group2projectstorage.dfs.core.windows.net/silver/combined/combined_data.parquet"

# Save DataFrame as Parquet
df_all_combined.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(output_path)

print("Data successfully saved to ADLS in Parquet format.")
